page.title: 19HOUSING
page.content: There are two small areas of housing in this survey area. On the east side of the A.34 is an area of recently built houses. Most of the houses are open plan. They are well maintained and owner occupied. There are two estates and they are named after trees, Cedar and Redwood. This 1970's building overlooks the pasture land that borders the River Trent. A footbridge leads across the A.34 to the interwar and 1960's housing of the Walton Estate. Two areas of recreation are to be found in the vicinity of the footbridge There is a Council maintained football field which also has a childrens play area. By the side of this field is an area of allotments.
